contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox Paris metro |Name=Pyramides {{access icon}} |Pic=[[File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 7 - Pyramides 03.jpg|275px]] |Day=1 July |Year=1916 |Access= |Municipality=the 1st arrondissement of Paris |Zone=1 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next|7|Palais Royal - Musée du Louvre|Opéra}} {{Paris Metro/next|14|Madeleine|Châtelet}} | X=130 | Y=63 }} '''Pyramides''' is a [[Metro station|station]] of the [[Paris Métro]]. It is named after the ''Rue des Pyramides'', which commemorates the victory in 1798 of [[Napoleon Bonaparte]]'s [[Armée d'Orient (1798)|Armée d’Orient]] over the [[Mamluk]]s of [[Murad Bey]] in the [[Battle of the Pyramids]] in [[Egypt]]. The line 7 station opened in 1916 and the line 14 station was opened at the line's inception in 1998. ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 7 - Pyramides 01.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 7|Line 7]] platforms at Pyramides File:Ligne-14-Pyramides1.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 14|Line 14]] platforms at Pyramides </gallery> {{commons category|Pyramides (Paris Metro)}} ==References== *Roland, Gérard (2003). ''Stations de métro. D’Abbesses à Wagram.'' Éditions Bonneton. {{Paris Metro/line 7}} {{Paris Metro/line 14}} {{coord|48.86587|N|2.33467|E|region:FR_type:railwaystation_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pyramides (Paris Metro)}} [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1916]]
